Campbell Circuit Court
The Com'mth of Kentucky Plaintiff
Against } Indictment for refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter
John W Flora & George Herendon Defendants

The Grand Jury of Campbell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse John W Flora & George Herendon of the offense of refusing to receive the vote of a qualified voter, committed as follows, viz; the Said John W Flora and Geo Herendon, on the day of August, 1865, and on divers other days and times, before and Since, that time, and before the finding of this Indictment, in the County and State aforesaid, Being officers of an Election then & there held at the Carthage Precinct, in Said County, under the Constitution and laws of the State aforesaid
, for the Election of a member of the Congress of the United States, for the Sixth Congressional District of Ky, a State Treasurer, a Senator from the 25th Senatorial District of Said State, Two members of the General Assembly for the County aforesaid, And a Clerk of the Circuit Court for the County aforesaid, The Said Flora, being then & there a Judge of Said Election, and the Said Herendon being then & there the Sheriff of the Said Election, and Severally acting as Such, at the time and place aforesaid, having been duly appointed and qualified as said Judge and Sheriff, the jury aforesaid in the name and by the authority aforesaid, do further Say that at the Election aforesaid, for the purpose aforesaid, at the Precinct and County aforesaid, on the day and year aforesaid Jacob Anderson, a qualified voter of Said Precinct and County, did then & there appear ^at the Polls^ before the Judges, Sheriff and Clerk
of the Said Election, between the hours of Seven Oclock A. M. and Six oclock P, M, and then & there did offer to vote -- Whereupon the Said John W. Flora & George Herendon as Judge and Sheriff of Said Election refuse to receive the vote of the Said Jacob Anderson, Contrary to the Statutes in Such Case made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky,

Witnesses
Jacob Anderson
John J Nelson
